intro: Ebermaiera neesii, commonly known as the Nees's ebermaiera, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that typically bloom in shades of yellow and orange. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the undergrowth of rainforests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
